text.p: Portugal attacked Albania relentlessly and easily won their European zone group nine World Cup qualifying match 2-0 on Saturday.
Striker Joao Vieira Pinto opened the score with a header from a pass by winger Sergio Conceicao in the 14th minute.

Conceicao, Dani and Pedro Barbosa all missed chances to score before midfielder Luis Figo, who was nearly dropped from the selection due to injury, slammed the ball into the net from a pass by midfielder Paulo Sousa in the 71st minute.
"We still have a good chance to qualify for the World Cup," Portuguese coach Artur Jorge said after the match. "Today our players showed their quality."
However, he said: "The Albanians were stronger than we had expected. We could have scored more goals."
Before the game, Jorge had promised to put on a display of aggressive football and go for goals in a match dubbed by the local media "Operation Albania".
After Ukraine held European champions Germany to a scoreless draw on Saturday, Portugal now stand in joint second place with Germany in the group with 12 points behind Ukraine with 14 points.

Portugal: 1-Vitor Baia, 2-Fernando Nelson, 3-Paulinho Santos, 4-Jorge Costa, 5-Fernando Couto, 6-Paulo Sousa, 7-Luis Figo (18-Cadete, 87th minute), 8-Joao Pinto (17-Nuno Gomes, 87th minute), 9-Domingos Oliveira (15-Pedro Barbosa, 20th minute), 10-Daniel Carvalho "Dani", 11-Sergio Conceicao.

Albania: 1-Blendi Mallisami, 2-Zamir Shduza (13-Afrim Tole, 76th minute), 3-Ilir Shulku, 4-Arjan Chumba, 5 Rudi Vata, 6-Salvador Kacaj, 7-Eduard Abazi, 8-Aldan Bushi, 9-Igli Tare, 10-Ahin Haxhi, 11-Amarildo Zela (15-Artan Villa, 46th minute).
